claim_evaluated: Can authenticate any manuscript with numerical confidence score
key_evidence: Engine produces scores in MUP zone (0.35-0.65) for difficult cases; these scores restate uncertainty rather than resolving it
assessor: V. Kellam (primary), P. Senth, M. Rostak, A. Vessk

claim_evaluated: Achieves breakthrough in authentication methodology
key_evidence: Engine confirms existing certainty and measures existing uncertainty; does not create new knowledge

claim_evaluated: Known forgeries score below 0.20; verified documents score above 0.80
key_evidence: Mink Pavar forgeries consistently score 0.12-0.18; unbroken provenance documents score 0.82-0.94

claim_evaluated: MUP zone scores provide actionable information
key_evidence: Technical analysis of mup zone scores provide actionable information methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Ink composition analysis is reliable indicator
key_evidence: Technical analysis of ink composition analysis is reliable indicator methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Parchment dating correlates with provenance
key_evidence: Technical analysis of parchment dating correlates with provenance methodology and results
assessor: V. Kellam (primary), P. Senth, A. Vessk

claim_evaluated: Weighted composite outperforms individual markers
key_evidence: Technical analysis of weighted composite outperforms individual markers methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Political influence does not affect scoring
key_evidence: Technical analysis of political influence does not affect scoring methodology and results

claim_evaluated: System reduces authentication disputes
key_evidence: Technical analysis of system reduces authentication disputes methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Achieves 73% accuracy in predicting creature emergence
key_evidence: 73% achieved only counting partial matches as successes; strict accuracy is 65.4%; improvement over folk knowledge is 4.4 percentage points
assessor: P. Senth (primary), V. Kellam, A. Vessk
response: Pollus Brent acknowledged methodology clarification needed

claim_evaluated: Environmental precursors permit early warning
key_evidence: Correlations exist but seasonal breakdown shows summer accuracy falls to 54% (near-chance); seasonal caveats not mentioned in promotional materials
response: Kem Vess acknowledged seasonal variation issue

claim_evaluated: Captures 'grammar' of creature behavior
key_evidence: Grammar implies stable rules; the 'grammar' changes daily; prime patterns exist but which prime governs which creature is unpredictable

claim_evaluated: Citation cascade analysis improves overall accuracy
key_evidence: Technical analysis of citation cascade analysis improves overall accuracy methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Method is reproducible across different analysts
key_evidence: Technical analysis of method is reproducible across different analysts methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Prime number patterns predict creature cycles
key_evidence: Technical analysis of prime number patterns predict creature cycles methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Folk rules can be systematically validated
key_evidence: Technical analysis of folk rules can be systematically validated methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Temperature correlation enables forecasting
key_evidence: Technical analysis of temperature correlation enables forecasting methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Barometric data improves warning window
key_evidence: Technical analysis of barometric data improves warning window methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Can classify journeys into reliable archetypes
key_evidence: Archetypes describe real patterns; ~17% of journeys remain unclassifiable; classification accuracy overstated in promotional materials

claim_evaluated: Archetypes are actionable for individual planning
key_evidence: Archetypes illuminate tendency, not fate; Bagbu: 'patterns are rhythms, not cages'; not actionable for mandatory classification
response: Traders' Guild cited assessment in successful opposition

claim_evaluated: Systematic observation improves on oral tradition
key_evidence: Technical analysis of systematic observation improves on oral tradition methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Yeller numbers appear in career transitions
key_evidence: Technical analysis of yeller numbers appear in career transitions methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Self-analysis methodology is replicable
key_evidence: Technical analysis of self-analysis methodology is replicable methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Archetype vocabulary aids policy discussion
key_evidence: Technical analysis of archetype vocabulary aids policy discussion methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Historical validation achieves 91% accuracy
key_evidence: 91% impressive but uses same data that could have informed model construction; alternative models achieve 78%; improvement over extrapolation is real but magnitude unclear
assessor: V. Kellam (primary), M. Rostak, P. Senth, A. Vessk

claim_evaluated: Method can predict spatial instability decades in advance
key_evidence: No conditions specified under which prediction would be falsified; cannot determine if visionary or unfalsifiable

claim_evaluated: Capital may enter unstable zone by Year 1000
key_evidence: If true, most important finding in cartographic history; if false, irresponsible fear-mongering; we cannot determine which

claim_evaluated: Correlation data identifies high-risk conditions
key_evidence: Technical analysis of correlation data identifies high-risk conditions methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Model generalizes across Quarry regions
key_evidence: Technical analysis of model generalizes across quarry regions methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Keth's mathematics are internally consistent
key_evidence: Technical analysis of keth's mathematics are internally consistent methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Bagbu data provides representative trader sample
key_evidence: Technical analysis of bagbu data provides representative trader sample methodology and results
assessor: V. Kellam (primary), P. Senth, A. Vessk

claim_evaluated: Predictive models can identify at-risk students
key_evidence: 72% accuracy for 'standard' students; 34% for 'non-standard' trajectories; cases most needing prediction are precisely those resisting it

claim_evaluated: Early intervention improves outcomes
key_evidence: Intervention paradox: if intervention causes success, original prediction not validated; if student would have succeeded anyway, intervention unnecessary; cannot distinguish

claim_evaluated: System can model individual student trajectories
key_evidence: JK-3847 case: 0% model accuracy, 12 anomalies logged, 7 of 12 interventions counterproductive; model assumes goal-directed behavior which not all exhibit
response: Project terminated; Crost published reflective paper

claim_evaluated: Method accounts for observer effects
key_evidence: Technical analysis of method accounts for observer effects methodology and results

claim_evaluated: Protocol-guided expeditions show 12% reduction in failure rates
key_evidence: 12% is relative improvement (17.1% to 14.3% = 2.8 points); absolute improvement is 2.8 percentage points in stable territory only
assessor: V. Kellam (primary), P. Senth, A. Vessk
response: Drusk acknowledged clarification on relative vs absolute needed

claim_evaluated: Protocol v1.0 prevents errors that kill experienced crews
key_evidence: A-3 disaster: three deaths in boundary territory where Protocol was followed exactly; Protocol designed for stable conditions failed catastrophically in unstable territory
response: Drusk accepted critique; joined revision team

claim_evaluated: Protocol v2.0 recognizes territorial stability tiers
key_evidence: Tiered system demonstrates genuine learning from A-3; Unknown Unknown Rule institutionalizes intuition; system now knows its limits
